title: LaFlore Live Probiotic Skincare Receives KIND TO BIOME Certification
author: Marisa Sobotka
description: LaFlore Live Probiotic Skincare, probiotic, microbiome, bacteria, AHA, PHA, BHA, vitamins like retinol, antimicrobial peptides, amino acids, micronutrients, antioxidants, anti-inflammatory substances, ceramides

The certification offers a recognizable mark that assures skin and scalp [microbiome](https://www.wellspa360.com/wellness/health/news/21723057/fermented-foods-linked-to-gut-microbiome-diversity) gentleness of products and ingredients for consumers. This international mark of quality has been achieved by LaFlore Live Probiotic Skincare through testing and evaluations of the formula's influences on the skin microbiome. The certification is validated by third-party experts including dermatologists and molecular microbiologists. Related: [How Can Improve Skin Health](https://www.wellspa360.com/spas/treatments/article/21154450/how-topical-probiotics-can-improve-skin-health) LaFlore Live Probiotic Skincare supports healthy skin by boosting the beneficial bacteria with live probiotics, rather than only probiotic extracts, essences or lysates. Live [probiotics ](https://www.wellspa360.com/products/article/21154574/using-probiotics-to-boost-the-health-of-and-beauty-of-the-complexion)help the microbiome produce postbiotics necessary for skin to and thrive naturally. These postbiotics include: AHAs, PHAs, anti-inflammatory substances, ceramides and more. "Due to the current state of cosmetic regulation and as the leader in the emerging category of probiotic skin care, we feel that it's our responsibility to provide unbiased scientific support to claims such as microbiome friendly," said Brent Ballard, chief operating officer of Dakota Biotech (LaFlore's parent company).
